channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Benefits of Shorter Campaigns
item.description: Presidential campaigns are marathons. Not this year.

item.title: Israel’s Conflicts With Hamas and Hezbollah Show No Sign of Easing

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah Trade Airstrikes, and U.S. Border Crossings Drop
item.description: Plus, an ambitious, risky private space mission.

item.title: Search Operation Underway After Fire in East London Apartment Building
item.description: More than 200 firefighters were at the scene of a fire in the Dagenham neighborhood on Monday morning. The building had a number of fire safety issues...

item.title: Are you sweating too much? A dermatologist says you should ask yourself these 4 questions
item.description: Not all sweaters are created equal.

item.title: Hong Kong Defends Sex Ed Advice That Includes Playing Badminton
item.description: Top officials in the Chinese territory have defended new sex education guidance that critics call regressive. Young people are amused.

item.title: Union leader says no taxes on tips is the flawed policy we need because ‘working class families can’t wait for aspirational ideas’
item.description: Eliminating taxes on tips is a welcome development, but nothing compared to the Holy Grail for service workers: raising the minimum wage.
